Class PCB 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----PCB
public class PCB
extends Object
PCB. Process Control Block. Keeps track of all the important numbers for a process. Whoo-hoo!

Version:
9.10.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ethan Georgi

eojMessage
pageTable
remarks

PCB(String, int, int, MOS, CPU)
Constructor.

addRemark(String)
Append a remark.
cardLoadedInMem(int)
Tells the process that a card has been loaded into memory at a specified location.
dataCardLoadedAt(int)
Tells the PCB that a data card has been loaded to the drisk, and supplies the track number where the card was written.
getC()
Return the results of the last compare, stored in the C register
getDataCard(int)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.
getIC()
Give me the IC for this PCB.
getIR()
Get the IR, which contains the last instruction this process executed.
getJobID()
Tell me the job id.
getMemoryCard(int)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.
getNextDataCard()
Get me the next data card.
getNextProgramCard()
Get me the next program card.
getNextSpooled()
The track number to write the block to for printing.
getNumDataCards()
Fetch the number of data cards on the drisk.
getNumMemoryCards()
Fetch the number of cards in memory.
getNumProgramCards()
Fetch the number of program cards on the drisk
getNumSpooled()
Fetch the number of blocks spooled.
getPrintLimit()
What is the PrintLimit for this process?
getProgramCard(int)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.
getR()
Returns R.
getSpooledBlock(int)
Gets the track number of the specified block that has been spooled for printing.
getTimeLimit()
What is the SmegLimit for this process?
getTimer()
Fetch the value of the timer.
getTimeSlice()
Fetch the value of the time slice counter.
incClocks()
Increments the time slice counter and timer counter.
programCardLoadedAt(int)
Tells the PCB that a program card has been loaded to the drisk, and supplies the track number where the card was written.
putOutput(int)
Lets the PCB know that where on the drisk the output was placed.
resetTimeSlice()
Reset the time slice counter to 0;
setC(int)
Hang on to the contents of the C register, so that we can have them around when we need them...
setIC(int)
Save the IC for posterity.

Save the IR.

Set the number of blocks spooled.
setR(String)
Save R for later.
storeRegisters(String, String, int, int)
Quick way to store the R, IR, C, and IC.
virtualToPhysical(int)
This function translates a virtual address to a physical address, if it's possible.

eojMessage 
 public String eojMessage[]
remarks 
 public String remarks[]
pageTable 
 public int pageTable[]

PCB 
 public PCB(String id,
            int tl,
            int pl,
            MOS rtMOS,
            CPU rtCPU)
Constructor. Creates a process.

Parameters:
id - The Job ID
tl - The maximum number of clock cycles to run this process for
pl - The maximum number of lines to print. (PD instructions)

virtualToPhysical 
 public int virtualToPhysical(int v)
This function translates a virtual address to a physical address, if it's possible. If there's no page loaded where you're looking... well, we just won't go there.

Parameters:
v - The Virtual Address
Returns:
The Physical Address
getJobID 
 public String getJobID()
Tell me the job id.

Returns:
The Job ID
getIC 
 public int getIC()
Give me the IC for this PCB. This contains the next instruction that this process is to execute. Used in context switching.

Returns:
the IC of the process
setIC 
 public void setIC(int ic)
Save the IC for posterity. Used in context switching.

Parameters:
ic - The values of the IC to save
getR 
 public String getR()
Returns R. Used in context switching.

Returns:
the register R
setR 
 public void setR(String r)
Save R for later. Used in context switching.

Parameters:
r - The value to save.
getIR 
 public String getIR()
Get the IR, which contains the last instruction this process executed. This is handy when Channel3 is given this process and has to find out if it needs a GD or PD... Used in context switching.

Returns:
the IR
setIR 
 public void setIR(String ir)
Save the IR. Used in context switching.

Parameters:
ir - The last instruction executed.
getC 
 public int getC()
Return the results of the last compare, stored in the C register

Returns:
the contents of the C register
setC 
 public void setC(int c)
Hang on to the contents of the C register, so that we can have them around when we need them... Used in context switching.

Parameters:
c - The contents of the C register (0/1)
storeRegisters 
 public void storeRegisters(String r,
                            String ir,
                            int c,
                            int ic)
Quick way to store the R, IR, C, and IC. For context switching.

Parameters:
r - The R register
ir - The IR register
c - The C register
ic - The IC register
cardLoadedInMem 
 public void cardLoadedInMem(int n)
Tells the process that a card has been loaded into memory at a specified location. The PCB must create a pointer to this card and update the number of cards it's keeping track of.

Parameters:
n - The track number that the card was written to memory.
programCardLoadedAt 
 public void programCardLoadedAt(int n)
Tells the PCB that a program card has been loaded to the drisk, and supplies the track number where the card was written. The PCB must create a pointer to this card and icnrease the counter that keeps track of the number of program cards we're keeping track of.

Parameters:
n - The track number where the program card was written.
dataCardLoadedAt 
 public void dataCardLoadedAt(int n)
Tells the PCB that a data card has been loaded to the drisk, and supplies the track number where the card was written. The PCB must create a pointer to this card and icnrease the counter that keeps track of the number of data cards we're keeping track of.

Parameters:
n - The track number where the data card was written.
getMemoryCard 
 public int getMemoryCard(int c)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.

Parameters:
c - The number of the card
getDataCard 
 public int getDataCard(int c)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.

Parameters:
c - The number of the card
getProgramCard 
 public int getProgramCard(int c)
Given the number of the card to look at (0, 1, 2, 3...) returns the track number where the card is stored on the drisk.

Parameters:
c - The number of the card
incClocks 
 public void incClocks()
Increments the time slice counter and timer counter.

resetTimeSlice 
 public void resetTimeSlice()
Reset the time slice counter to 0;

getTimeSlice 
 public int getTimeSlice()
Fetch the value of the time slice counter. This value is the number of CPU clock cycles for which this process has been active/running. Therefore, it is always <= 15. When time slice counter reaches 15, the process gets switched.

Returns:
The value of the time slice counter
getTimer 
 public int getTimer()
Fetch the value of the timer. This is the total number of CPU clock cycles for which this process has run. It's ceiling is the TimeLimit set by the control card on creation.

Returns:
The total number clock cycles this process has been active.
getNextDataCard 
 public int getNextDataCard()
Get me the next data card.

Returns:
The track number of the next card on the drisk.
getNextProgramCard 
 public int getNextProgramCard()
Get me the next program card.

Returns:
The track number of the next card on the drisk.
putOutput 
 public void putOutput(int l)
Lets the PCB know that where on the drisk the output was placed.

Parameters:
l - The track number where the output was spooled on the drisk
getSpooledBlock 
 public int getSpooledBlock(int b)
Gets the track number of the specified block that has been spooled for printing.

Parameters:
b - The block number
Returns:
The track number on the drisk
getNextSpooled 
 public int getNextSpooled()
The track number to write the block to for printing.

Returns:
The track number where the next block is stored on the drisk
getNumSpooled 
 public int getNumSpooled()
Fetch the number of blocks spooled.

Returns:
The number of blocks spooled for printing
setNumSpooled 
 public void setNumSpooled(int n)
Set the number of blocks spooled.

Parameters:
n - The new number of blocks spooled for printing
getNumMemoryCards 
 public int getNumMemoryCards()
Fetch the number of cards in memory.

Returns:
The number of cards in memory.
getNumDataCards 
 public int getNumDataCards()
Fetch the number of data cards on the drisk.

Returns:
The number of data cards on the drisk.
getNumProgramCards 
 public int getNumProgramCards()
Fetch the number of program cards on the drisk

Returns:
The number of program cards on the drisk.
addRemark 
 public void addRemark(String r)
Append a remark.

Parameters:
r - The remark to add to the array of remarks.
getPrintLimit 
 public int getPrintLimit()
What is the PrintLimit for this process?

Returns:
the PrintLimit
getTimeLimit 
 public int getTimeLimit()
What is the SmegLimit for this process?

Returns:
the TimeLimit
